Class Sorts

  • java.lang.Object
    • Sorts

  • public class Sorts
extends java.lang.Object
    The Sorts class provides an API for sorting int arrays in ascending order.
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Robert James Meade

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Sorts() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void bubbleSort(int[] arr)
      The bubbleSort method implements Bubble Sort, an in place iterative sorting algorithm.
      static void heapSort(int[] arr)
      The heapSort method implements heap Sort, An in place sorting algorithm invented by J.
      static void insert(int[] arr, int index, int n)
      The insert method shifts all elements 1 to the left of the specified index and inserts the given value at that index.
      static void insertionSort(int[] arr)
      The insertionSort method implements Insertion Sort, a stable and in place sorting algorithm.
      static boolean isSorted(int[] arr, boolean ascending)
      The isSorted method checks if an array is sorted ascending or descending.
      static void maxHeapify(int[] arr, int to)
      The maxHeapify method creates a max heap data structure out of a given array.
      static void merge(int[] arr, int from, int middle, int to)
      The merge method merges two sorted sub-arrays contained in a given array back into that given array.
      static void mergeSort(int[] arr, int from, int to)
      The mergeSort method implements Merge Sort, A recursive sorting algorithm invented by John von Neumann in 1945.
      static void quickSort(int[] arr, int from, int to)
      The quickSort method implements quick Sort, A recursive, in place sorting algorithm invented by C.A.R Hoare in 1962.
      static void selectionSort(int[] arr)
      The selectionSort method implements Selection Sort, an in place iterative sorting algorithm.
      static void siftDown(int[] arr, int from, int to)
      The siftDown method corrects the ordering in a portion of a max heap data structure iteratively.
      static void swap(int[] arr, int index1, int index2)
      The swap method swaps elements in the two specified array indices.

    • Method Detail

      • bubbleSort

        public static void bubbleSort(int[] arr)
        The bubbleSort method implements Bubble Sort, an in place iterative sorting algorithm. This implementation is stable (the original ordering is preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n^2)
        • worst: O(n^2)
        • best: O(n)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(1)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort

      • selectionSort

        public static void selectionSort(int[] arr)
        The selectionSort method implements Selection Sort, an in place iterative sorting algorithm. This implementation is not stable (the original ordering is not necessarily preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n^2)
        • worst: O(n^2)
        • best: O(n^2)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(1)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort

      • insertionSort

        public static void insertionSort(int[] arr)
        The insertionSort method implements Insertion Sort, a stable and in place sorting algorithm. This implementation is stable (the original ordering is preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n^2)
        • worst: O(n^2)
        • best: O(n)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(1)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort

      • mergeSort

        public static void mergeSort(int[] arr,
                             int from,
                             int to)
        The mergeSort method implements Merge Sort, A recursive sorting algorithm invented by John von Neumann in 1945. This implementation is not stable (the original ordering is not necessarily preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n log n)
        • worst: O(n log n)
        • best: O(n log n)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(n)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort
        from - starting index (inclusive)
        to - ending index (exclusive)

      • quickSort

        public static void quickSort(int[] arr,
                             int from,
                             int to)
        The quickSort method implements quick Sort, A recursive, in place sorting algorithm invented by C.A.R Hoare in 1962. This implementation is not stable (the original ordering is not necessarily preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n log n)
        • worst: O(n^2)
        • best: O(n log n)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(1)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort
        from - starting index (inclusive)
        to - ending index (exclusive)

      • heapSort

        public static void heapSort(int[] arr)
        The heapSort method implements heap Sort, An in place sorting algorithm invented by J. W. J. Williams in 1964. This implementation is not stable (the original ordering is not necessarily preserved). \nRunning time:
        • average: O(n log n)
        • worst: O(n log n)
        • best: O(n log n)
        Memory Usage:
        • O(1)
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to sort

      • isSorted

        public static boolean isSorted(int[] arr,
                               boolean ascending)
        The isSorted method checks if an array is sorted ascending or descending.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to check
        ascending - Check ascending (true) or Check descending (false)
        Returns:
        is the array in the specified ordering

      • swap

        public static void swap(int[] arr,
                        int index1,
                        int index2)
        The swap method swaps elements in the two specified array indices.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to swap elements of
        index1 - first index to swap
        index2 - second index to swap

      • insert

        public static void insert(int[] arr,
                          int index,
                          int n)
        The insert method shifts all elements 1 to the left of the specified index and inserts the given value at that index.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to insert element in
        index - Index to insert element at
        n - Value to insert

      • merge

        public static void merge(int[] arr,
                         int from,
                         int middle,
                         int to)
        The merge method merges two sorted sub-arrays contained in a given array back into that given array. The sub-arrays are defined by the specified indices.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to merge sub-arrays in to
        from - start index (inclusive in first half)
        middle - middle index (inclusive in second half, exclusive in first half)
        to - end index (not inclusive)

      • maxHeapify

        public static void maxHeapify(int[] arr,
                              int to)
        The maxHeapify method creates a max heap data structure out of a given array.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to heapify in max ordering
        to - index to end heap data structure at (not inclusive)

      • siftDown

        public static void siftDown(int[] arr,
                            int from,
                            int to)
        The siftDown method corrects the ordering in a portion of a max heap data structure iteratively.
        Parameters:
        arr - Array to correct ordering of max heap portion in
        from - parent index (inclusive)
        to - ending index for heapifying (not inclusive)
